org.ardenus.audio

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ardenus.audio.Sound
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Deletable, ResourceListener

    public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
implements ResourceListener, Deletable
    Represents a source in OpenAL, can be used to easily play audio that can also be mapped to a language.
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

      • addRepeatingSoundEvent

        public void addRepeatingSoundEvent(int id,
                                   long startTimeMillis,
                                   long repeatTimeMillis,
                                   int triggerCount)
        Adds a repeating sound event.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the sound event.
        startTimeMillis - the time in milliseconds the event should first be triggered.
        repeatTimeMillis - the time to wait in milliseconds before the event is triggered again.
        triggerCount - the amount of times the event should trigger -1 for an infinite amount of times.

      • addRepeatingSoundEvent

        public void addRepeatingSoundEvent(int id,
                                   long startTimeMillis,
                                   long repeatTimeMillis)
        Adds a repeating sound event.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the sound event.
        startTimeMillis - the time in milliseconds the event should first be triggered.
        repeatTimeMillis - the time to wait in milliseconds before the event is triggered again.

        public void fade(float volume,
                 long fadeTime,
                 boolean stopAfterFade)
        Fades the sound to the specified volume.
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume to fade to.
        fadeTime - how long in milliseconds to transition the volume.
        stopAfterFade - true to stop the sound when the sound has transitioned, false otherwise.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Calling this method is the same as calling destroy(). However, this is implemented as to make the Sound class compatible with the Deletable interface.
        Specified by:
